data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Face forward always. As you always face forward, if you take a step backward from the starting point, you do so with 9 steps right. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
On the same side as turning around, you are going to turn right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you turn around you get back to the beginning point. If you follow the directions and bring the starting point back to where you started then you won’ t be able to return to the starting point in 6 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

As you enter the second building, take 5 steps. If the instructions say take the same amount of steps twice, then the last step is equal to 7 and after reading the instructions it means that you must take the same number of steps in order to return to the previous one. It also means that you must move your body at a constant speed. So, the answer is yes.

Turn left for 9 steps, then turn around for 5 steps. So, the answer is no.

If you always face forward, you are not going back when you do the next step. If you always take all 1 step forward, you are not going forward. If you never take any 4 step forward, you are not going forward. If you always take all 6 step forward, you are not going forward. So, the answer is No.

You can not find the starting point at 9 steps. A person would not turn around twice. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you could take 3 steps to take 3 steps forward. If you always face forward, you can take 1 step backward with a straight face only. If you always face forward, you could take 3 steps forward, but not take 1 step backward. Thus, the answer is No.

It takes 4 steps to be right. It takes 8 steps to be back. So, the answer is No.

At the beginning, take 3 steps forward, then 3 steps backward. At the end, take 10 steps left. At the end, take 6 steps left. At the end, take 3 steps forward, then take 3 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

It is one and done (so far) and done over and over. The answer: No.

When you take two steps backward, you are returning to the starting point. When you take three steps backward, you are returning to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

You either take some numbers or take a number. Once you take numbers you do not take them again any more. You can either take a number or a number. If you take a number you get to do something else, take that number instead. One step is a direct return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

You will always fall. The more steps you take backwards you take the more backwards you go. The more steps you take forwards you go, the more forwards you go and the less backwards you go the more forwards you go. So, the answer is No.

Forward facing will always bring you back to your starting point. Take 8 steps left = 6 steps left. 1 step backward will bring you back to your starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you are always facing forward, you always take 4 steps forward and 2 steps left. There is no way back to starting point if you are facing opposite ways, not necessarily backwards. It does not take 10 steps right to go right. One needs to take 4 steps forward to be back in the beginning. So, the answer is No.
